The SLA determined in the previous step can be considered a reasonable proxy for the ELA in each year
38 . On the other hand, to project the future change in the ELA on QIC over the course of the 21 st century, we take advantage of the close linear relationship between ELA and FLH on tropical Andean glaciers
1 . We first calculated FLH over QIC using bias-corrected reanalysis data over the period of overlap with satellite data. The FLH is calculated as the average of the hydrologic year, which runs from Sep. to Aug. Finally, projected future changes in the ELA were calculated by applying the present day FLH-ELA relationship to future FLH simulated by bias-corrected CMIP5 models, as outlined in the Data and Methods section.
